TopicTitle: You Know You're A Nerd When:

Articles.Content: When you have three different NASA shirts and zero band shirts.
When someone mentions a football team and you ask, "They do...basketball, right?"

When you switch on wake up your computer to return into the Real Life.

 

On 20.07.2016 at 8:03 PM, cubinator said:

That's basically what SpaceX said when they came up with the Falcon Heavy...it's literally three Falcon 9's strapped together.

But this works in KSP (tm)
When you remember the name of every warframe in Warframe. And when you watch the Big Bang Theory
When you're excited about Battlefield 1 for completely other reasons (historical setting, landships, calvary, etc.)
When you can name every every character in GoT.
When you read your school supplies list, ignore it, and buy a few notebooks because you already know you never use half the stuff they write on there.

When you know that 92220 Evening Star was the last steam locomotive built in the UK... And you're American.

 

And what you don't need to be a nerd to know is that sharp steel pipes puncture tires... as happened to my dad's truck this morning...

Edited September 3, 2016 by UnionPacific1983WP

12 minutes ago, UnionPacific1983WP said:

And what you don't need to be a nerd to know is that sharp steel pipes puncture tires... as happened to my dad's truck this morning...

...but if you are a nerd, you'll know that even a blunt sphere will puncture 4-dimensional truck tires!
When you get the answer to a problem, then do the work.

When you have a separate cube for OH and another for normal solves.

When you need large cuboids for a new challenge.
When Children of a Dead Earth instills as much hype in you as KSP.
When you actively apply Yoda and Obi-Wan's advice to real life situations every day, with positive results.
When you have enough experience with twisty puzzles that you can solve several unique puzzles that you've never even seen before using only prior knowledge from different puzzles.

On 12.09.2016 at 0:40 AM, 0111narwhalz said:

When you get the answer to a problem, then do the work.

When you get the answer to a problem, then avoid the work.

When you have your own name for McDonnell-Douglass, McDouglass, because the original is too long.

When you can name more planes than bands.

McDouglass F-4 Phantom II, naval fighter-bomber

Northrop F-5 Tiger, export/wannabe F-16

Grumman F-14 Tomcat, naval fighter/interceptor

McDouglass F-15 Eagle, air superiority fighter

General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon,  multirole fighter/dogfighter

Boeing/McDouglass F/A-18 Hornet/Super Hornet, naval multirole fighter/strike fighter

 F-22 Raptor, stealth air superiority fighter

Lockheed F-35 Lightning II/JSF, stealth multirole "fighter"

 

A-10 Warthog,  ground attack/flying tank

Embraer EMD 314/A-21 Super Tunaco

707, 717, 727, 737, 747,  757,  767,  777, 787

MiGs 15, 17, 21, 25, 29, 31

SU-37

F2F, 3F, 4F, 5F, 6F, 7F, 8F, 9F

B-17, 18, 24, 25, 29, 52

B-1, 2, 21

SR-71

 

 

Edited September 26, 2016 by TheKosanianMethod
Hornet

When you spend over $100 on a keyboard.
^not ^crazy ^compared ^to ^r/mechanicalkeyboards

17 hours ago, TheKosanianMethod said:

Embraer EMD 314/A-21 Super Tunaco

Had to double-take, no, that did not say "Super Taco"

Kind of an odd looking bird, but I guess that huge canopy helps with visibility. I'm not used to the cockpit looking so big compared to the rest of the aircraft.
You know you're a nerd when you try to look up an element on your calendar.

Well, the date today is Osmium 3rd, 20Sodium...

When "wormhole" is associated with space, not with apple.

When you can identify dilithium with a visual inspection.

...When

girls never cared you in high school looks your hands when you have one of hottest girls in your shoulders when you are CEO of  one of most profitable companies in the world
